soap.local.api

Class ILoginAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.soap.SOAPServiceBase
      • soap.local.api.ILoginAPI

  • public class ILoginAPI
extends SOAPServiceBase

    A remote interface that allows a user to log in and out of a system. The system uses conversations to implement SOAP authentication in a Guidewire application (e.g. BillingCenter, ClaimCenter, PolicyCenter). When connecting to Guidewire applications the caller must first authenticate using the ILoginAPI.login() method. This method returns the the session ID of the server session.

    On each successive call in the conversation, pass the session ID in the SOAP header {@link gw.pl.util.webservices.Globals#GW_AUTHENTICATION_SECURITY_TOKEN_CONTEXT_PROPERTY}. You must call logout() when you are done with the conversation.

    NOTE: This API is intended for users who are using Guidewire's web services from languages other than Java. If you are using Java, you should use the APILocator instead.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class gw.api.soap.SOAPServiceBase

        Handlers, PERF_TIMING_REF, URL

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String WSSLogin(String userName, String password)
      Logs the user in preparation for a Web Service Security (WSS) conversation. A WSS conversation is one in which user credentials are passed using the WSS UsernameToken profile. NOTE: The Guidewire Toolkit does not currently support this method. This method is available for access by all other SOAP clients.
      void WSSLogout(String userName)
      Terminates a WSS conversation. Attempts to log out a user not logged in are siltently ignored.

      NOTE: Usage of this method by the Guidewire Toolkit is not currently supported. This is available for access by all other SOAP clients.
      String login(String userName, String password)
      Logs the user into a Guidewire application (e.g. ClaimCenter, PolicyCenter, BillingCenter). Returns the session ID of the server session.
      void logout(String sessionID)
      Logs the user out of the session. The session will timeout if this method is not called.

      • Methods inherited from class gw.api.soap.SOAPServiceBase

    • Method Detail

      • WSSLogin

        String WSSLogin(String userName,
              String password)

        Logs the user in preparation for a Web Service Security (WSS) conversation. A WSS conversation is one in which user credentials are passed using the WSS UsernameToken profile.

        NOTE: The Guidewire Toolkit does not currently support this method. This method is available for access by all other SOAP clients.

        Parameters:
        userName -
        password -
        Returns:

      • WSSLogout

        void WSSLogout(String userName)
        Terminates a WSS conversation. Attempts to log out a user not logged in are siltently ignored.

        NOTE: Usage of this method by the Guidewire Toolkit is not currently supported. This is available for access by all other SOAP clients.

        Parameters:
        userName -

      • login

        String login(String userName,
           String password)
        Logs the user into a Guidewire application (e.g. ClaimCenter, PolicyCenter, BillingCenter). Returns the session ID of the server session.
        Parameters:
        userName - The user name to authenticate.
        password - The password to authenticate with.
        Returns:
        A valid session ID.

      • logout

        void logout(String sessionID)
        Logs the user out of the session. The session will timeout if this method is not called.
        Parameters:
        sessionID - the session ID of the server session.
